sfDeploy

public void sfDeploy()
              throws org.smartfrog.sfcore.common.SmartFrogException,
                     java.rmi.RemoteException
Called after instantiation for deployment purposed. Heart monitor is started and if there is a parent the deployed component is added to the heartbeat. Subclasses can override to provide additional deployment behavior.

Specified by:
sfDeploy in interface org.smartfrog.sfcore.prim.Prim
Overrides:
sfDeploy in class org.smartfrog.sfcore.prim.PrimImpl
Throws:
org.smartfrog.sfcore.common.SmartFrogException - error while deploying
java.rmi.RemoteException - In case of network/rmi error

sfStart

public void sfStart()
             throws org.smartfrog.sfcore.common.SmartFrogException,
                    java.rmi.RemoteException
Can be called to start components. Subclasses should override to provide functionality Do not block in this call, but spawn off any main loops!

Specified by:
sfStart in interface org.smartfrog.sfcore.prim.Prim
Overrides:
sfStart in class org.smartfrog.sfcore.prim.PrimImpl
Throws:
org.smartfrog.sfcore.common.SmartFrogException - failure while starting
java.rmi.RemoteException - In case of network/rmi error

                           java.lang.String hostname,

                           java.lang.String suitename,
                           long timestamp)
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                           org.smartfrog.sfcore.common.SmartFrogException
Start listening to a test suite

Specified by:
listen in interface TestListenerFactory
Parameters:
suite - the test suite that is about to run. May be null, especially during testing.
hostname - name of host
processname - name of the process
suitename - name of test suite
timestamp - start timestamp (UTC)
Returns:
a listener to talk to
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - network problems
